content:
Posted: July 5, 2016
Early Access Review
								I am a big fan of these silly clumsy beat 'em up party games like Bomb Squad and Gang Beasts. So I have high hopes for Aiball. It's an open market with a lot of interesting opportunities.Right now if you get the game you get what you pay for. The developers make no false promises here, they say that only basic content is accessible. It is even noted as early access. I actually really appreciate that they would price the game reasonably, for $1.99 I have no ill feelings about not being able to do much.In Aiball you control a cute little claymation figure and clumsily try to play soccer. Everything is moveable from the ball, to the flags, to the seats, to even the goals. It was pretty funny dragging goals around. There are three modes with one map each. There is the soccer mode with the map in the screenshots, a king of the hill mode and a sandbox mode.The king of the hill map is a bland (read: everything is grey) mountainside with boxes falling down. I have no idea what to do and it is pretty hard to get up the mountain. The sandbox mode is even more lame with an empty black space with two boxes that can be moved around with crappy physics. Don't get me wrong, I'm not hating. I totally get the game is in early access and I'm sure more will be added later. Just want the users to be aware that the soccer mode is really the only interesting mode at present.There seems to be some keymapping and joystick support which is cool but I cannot figure out how to get additional players to move. So while I recommend the game and its potential I would probably tell users to wait to buy it until additional player controls are sorted out. It was amusing to play alone but would be way more with friends. If I could get the controls working this would be really funny for a group of four friends and definitely worth the $1.99 fee (and maybe more).@Devs, feel free to comment on this review if y'all get the additional character support figured out and I'd be happy to amend this review.
